page.title: 03CHURCH
page.content: {CHURCH} St John's Church Smalley is built of stone and stands in an extensive churchyard at the southern end of the village, hidden from the main road by trees. It is very pleasant and quiet there. Inside, the church has a large, light nave and a small chancel.The church tower in which hang the bells, is separate from the main church buildings which is unusual. {BAPTIST CHURCH} The Baptist Church stands in the centre of the village separated from the road by a small graveyard in which we found one gravestone dating back to 1890 (Elizabeth Woolley). The church is built of brick and is rectangular in shape with a small extension on one side. The roof is high and covered with grey slates. Five windows have stained glass.
